Detailed Description

Definitions for handling generic 2d images (mainly for testings).

Note:
This module does not have any relationship to Cell.

Function Documentation

int ctk_image_create ( ctk_image_t *  img,
int  w,
int  h,
int  xoffset,
int  pixels_per_line,
int  bytes_per_pixel,
int  data_size 
)

Creates a new RGB image with given parameters.

Parameters:
[in] img - pointer of the image structure.
[in] w - the image width
[in] h - the image height
[in] xoffset - number of pixels offset in X direction
[in] pixels_per_line - # of pixels per line (-1 to use default (= w))
[in] bytes_per_pixel - # of bytes per pixel (-1 to use default (= 3))
[in] data_size - size of the image buffer (-1 to use default)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) if succeeded, errno on failure.

int ctk_image_create_align ( ctk_image_t *  img,
int  w,
int  h,
int  xoffset,
int  pixels_per_line,
int  bytes_per_pixel,
int  data_size,
int  align 
)

Creates a new RGB image with aligned image buffer.

Parameters:
[in] img - pointer of the image structure.
[in] w - the image width
[in] h - the image height
[in] xoffset - number of pixels offset in X direction
[in] pixels_per_line - # of pixels per line (-1 to use default (= w))
[in] bytes_per_pixel - # of bytes per pixel (-1 to use default (= 3))
[in] data_size - size of the image buffer (-1 to use default)
[in] align - an alignment size (must be power of 2). The allocated buffer size will be multiple of this value.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) if succeeded, errno on failure.

int ctk_image_destroy ( ctk_image_t *  img  ) 

Destroys the image buffer.

Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) if succeeded, errno on failure.
